content: In that case, the investigation would consider the specific circumstances of the event and determine whether the aircraft design, systems, and procedures were in compliance with regulations and standards. The investigation might determine that the loss of the aircraft was a result of factors beyond the acceptable risk established by regulatory bodies, or it might conclude that the aircraft's design, systems, and procedures were adequate and the loss was an unavoidable result of the event. The goal of such investigations is to identify areas for improvement and prevent similar incidents from happening in the future.
